game

Class SuitableLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.SuitableLocation

  • public class SuitableLocation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for finding a suitable location to add an Actor onto a map. This class is necessary because it is inevitable that the expected new location of the actor has already been occupied by the other actor. Under this circumstance, the nearest location where the actor can be added needs to be determined.
    Author:
    Kee Pei Jiin

    • Method Detail

      • findSuitableLocation

        public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location findSuitableLocation()
        Determines a suitable location for the actor to be added onto the map
        Returns:
        the location where actor should be added onto the map

      • suitableLocAroundExpectedLoc

        private edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location suitableLocAroundExpectedLoc()
                                                                 throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Determines whether actor can be added to the map at the given actor's expected location. If the given location is not suitable, the method will determine and return the nearest suitable location for the actor to be added onto the map. A suitable location is a location that does not contain any other actor and has a passable terrain.
        Returns:
        a location where the actor will be added onto the map
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when expectedNewLoc is null

      • suitableLocAlongBorder

        private edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location suitableLocAlongBorder()
        Determines whether actor can be added to the map at the top left or bottom right corner of the map. If actor cannot be added to these two locations, this method will find and return a location along the map border which is suitable for actor to be added. A suitable location is a location that does not contain any other actor and has a passable terrain.
        Returns:
        a location which is at/near the map border and actor will be added onto the map at this location

      • findNewLocation

        private edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location findNewLocation(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location startingLoc,
                                                           int[][] nearbyCoords)
                                                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        This method is called when the given location where the actor is expected to be at is not suitable for actor to be added. This method continuously find the next nearest neighbour location and checks if the location is suitable for actor to be added until a suitable location has been found.
        Parameters:
        startingLoc - The initial location where the actor is expected to be at.
        nearbyCoords - A list of x, y offset values. The coordinates of all the neighbour locations can be determined when these offset values are added to the coordinates of startingLoc.
        Returns:
        A neighbour location that is suitable for actor to be added or null when none of the neighbour location is suitable
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when either startingLoc or nearbyCoords is null

      • computeNewLocation

        private edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location computeNewLocation(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location startingLoc,
                                                              int[] coordPair)
                                                       throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Computes the coordinates of neighbour location and determines if the location is suitable for actor to be added.
        Parameters:
        startingLoc - The initial location where the actor is expected to be at
        coordPair - A pair of offset values that will be added to the coordinates of strtingLoc to obtain the new neighbour location
        Returns:
        The neighbour location if the location is suitable for actor to be added or null when the neighbour location is not suitable
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when either startingLoc or coordPair is null

      • withinMapRange

        private boolean withinMapRange(int x,
                               int y)
                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Determine if a location is within the X, Y range of the destination map.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of a location
        y - y-coordinate of a location
        Returns:
        true if the location coordinates are within the X, Y range of the map, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when either x or y is null.
